stimulusHtml: For what value of  x  does the box have the maximum possible volume? Note: The volume of a rectangular solid with length l, width w, and height h is  V = l w h .

features.html:
• On the left of the figure is a 12 inch by 12 inch square with both vertical and horizontal dashed lines set x inches in from each side of the square. For this square:
    • The dashed lines intersect to form an x inch by x inch square at each of the four corners of the original square.
    • The smaller x inch by x inch squares are shaded.
  • On the right of the figure is an open box with no top. For this box:
    • The box is created by removing the x inch by x inch squares from the original square and folding up the resulting sides.
    • The box is labeled with a height of x.

The figure shows a square sheet of cardboard on the left and an open box on the right. The square sheet has side length  12  inches (in) and is used to make the open box by removing from each of the four corners a square of side length x inches, and folding up the sides.
